intro: Ctenodon weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's ctenodon, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and small, clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Ctenodon weberbaueri is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
